hero.title: Mariahangin Island: A tale of indigenous land, power and resistance
hero.description: In the remote reaches of southern Palawan, a 38-hectare island paradise is at the center of a brewing social conflict. Once home to nearly 200 families of mostly Molbog and Cagayanen descent, Mariahangin island’s population is rapidly declining.

primary.title: <abbr title="Department of Education">DepEd</abbr> highlights urgent reforms in education as School Year 2025–2026 opens
primary.description: As public schools welcomed a new school year this week, Department of Education (DepEd) Secretary Sonny Angara on Wednesday, June 18, addressed the agency’s urgent priorities

secondary.title: First day blues: Teachers see 'recycled solutions' for chronic shortages
secondary.description: Three different major teachers' groups used the first day of classes on June 16 to blast the government for what they called "recycled" solutions to old education issues.

secondary.title: Classes for SY 2025-2026 begin despite flood, fire damage in some schools
secondary.description: Classes opened nationwide on Monday for School Year 2025-2026 with over 27 million students expected to return to classrooms. Some schools however had to adjust after flooding and fire incidents.

secondary.title: For a better life: Teachers leaving Negros public schools for US jobs
secondary.description: The exodus of educators from the Negros Island Region shows the challenges and new prospects for local education in the country

carousel.title: Killing of P200 pay hike bill also kills bid for living wage
carousel.description: MANILA, Philippines — To have a basic but decent standard of living, a local think tank stressed the need for a P1,217 living wage in Metro Manila, where most workers are compelled to make do with a minimum wage of P608 to P645.

carousel.title: Social media 101: Understanding Facebook algorithm and the effect of post ‘bumping’ (Last of 2 parts)
carousel.description: This article, the second part of "SOCMED 101," delves into how Facebook algorithms and "post bumping" contribute to the spread of fake news in the Philippines.

carousel.title: The Philippines "war on drugs"
carousel.description: The effect of former President Duterte's lethal "war on drugs" in Philippines is still felt and seen today, where reforms are slow to come.

carousel.title: Embracing domestic helpers as family: How respect transforms Hong Kong homes completely
carousel.description: While stories of exploitation about Hong Kong’s domestic helpers often dominate headlines, these uplifting tales show a different side of Hong Kong’s heart.
